thread.title: Lightning postpones harriers' Yavapai County championships
thread.title_full: Lightning postpones harriers' Yavapai County championships

title: Lightning postpones harriers' Yavapai County championships
text: Doug Cook The Daily Courier PRESCOTT - The Yavapai County Cross-Country Championships, scheduled for Wednesday afternoon, Oct. 21, at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University in Prescott, were postponed because of lightning from a chilly fall thunderstorm.Bradshaw Mountain High coach Mike Simon confirmed that the annual meet, which was supposed to be run at 4 p.m. Wednesday, is being tentatively planned for the same time on Friday, Oct. 23, at ERAU.Host Prescott as well as other county-based squads, including Bradshaw Mountain and Chino Valley, use the county meet to gauge their progress over the course of the season, and as a tune-up for the sectional and state championship meets.Dates, times and locations have not been finalized for the sectional championships, but the state finals are slated for Saturday, Nov. 7, at Cave Creek Golf Course in Phoenix. Prescott and Bradshaw Mountain compete in Division II, Section I. Chino Valley is part of D-III, Section II.
